net.sf.openrds
Interface IMainNode

All Superinterfaces:
INode, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
public interface IMainNode
extends INode

Interface for the Main Node implementation.
A main node is responsible for distributing requisitions, controlling process nodes and load-balancing.
All requisitions to be processed must be passed to the main node, and never directly to a process node.
When the main node receives a new requisition, it will determine the best available node to process it and send the requistion for that node, to process it.

Author:
Rodrigo

          Checks if this main node controls a node with the given name
 IProcessNode[] getControlledNodes()
          Retrieves the list of nodes beeing controlled by this main node.
Please note that it is impossible to ensure that all nodes are reachable.
 void processAsyncRequisition(Requisition requisition)
          Adds the given requisition to be processed asynchronously.
Warning: using this method won't give you any result, even if the requisition fails to process by any reason.
 void removeFromControl(IProcessNode processNode)
          Removes the given process node from beeing controlled by this main node.
 void waitIdle()
          Waits this main node to be IDLE (with no pending requisitions).
Be aware that this method can block forever since the main node can be constantly receiving requisitions.
 
Methods inherited from interface net.sf.openrds.INode
addNodeEventListener, finish, getClockAmount, getMemoryAmount, getNodeName, processRequisition, removeNodeEventListener
 

Method Detail

processAsyncRequisition

public void processAsyncRequisition(Requisition requisition)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Adds the given requisition to be processed asynchronously.
Warning: using this method won't give you any result, even if the requisition fails to process by any reason. The only possible errors that you get when calling this method are communication errors while sending the requisition to the main node.

Parameters:
requisition - requisition to be processed asynchronously
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication error

addToControl

public void addToControl(IProcessNode processNode)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Adds the given process node to be controlled by this main node. Client applications should never call this method directly, since it is only used by the process node itself.

Parameters:
processNode - node to be controlled.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication or runtime error

removeFromControl

public void removeFromControl(IProcessNode processNode)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Removes the given process node from beeing controlled by this main node. Client applications should never call this method directly, since it is only used by the process node itself.

Parameters:
processNode - node to be removed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication or runtime error

controlsNode

public boolean controlsNode(java.lang.String nodeName)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Checks if this main node controls a node with the given name

Parameters:
nodeName - node name
Returns:
true if the given node is controlled by this main node.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication or runtime error

getControlledNodes

public IProcessNode[] getControlledNodes()
                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Retrieves the list of nodes beeing controlled by this main node.
Please note that it is impossible to ensure that all nodes are reachable.

Returns:
IProcessNode[] nodes
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication or runtime error

waitIdle

public void waitIdle()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Waits this main node to be IDLE (with no pending requisitions).
Be aware that this method can block forever since the main node can be constantly receiving requisitions.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on any communication or runtime error
Since:
OpenRDS 0.3
